intro: Excoecaria borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean croton, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its alternate, simple leaves that are usually green with a waxy texture. Its flowers are small and clustered, often surrounded by bracts that are brightly colored. The plant is adapted to the humid, shaded environments of tropical lowland forests.
